result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexandra C Mahon

records.addlTxt: Jury trial - 12 person on April 4, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on March 10, 2023 at 08:45 am.

(Case called at 9:54 AM) Defendant Alexandra C Mahon in court with Attorney Roger M Hillestad.  Attorney Trenton Piltz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense waives reading of the Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. Court receives Not Guilty pleas. Defense requests to set this case for jury trial. 
Court advises counsel to schedule Jury Trial with Branch 4 Judicial Assistant.

9:55 AM case called. Defendant Alexandra C Mahon in court.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Alexandra C Mahon.  Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
There is no agreement at this time. Defense enters not guilty pleas which are received by the Court. Case is referred to branch 4 to schedule a status conference.

10:18 AM Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alexandra C Mahon not in court, she had car trouble and not able to appear.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Alexandra C Mahon. 

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 08/15/22 at 1:30pm
Hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
